description: From Middle French commentaire, from Latin commentārius, commentārium (“notebook”), compare French commentaire. See comment.

entries.meaning: A series of comments or annotations; especially, a book of explanations or expositions on the whole or a part of some other work.
(usually in the plural) A brief account of transactions or events written hastily, as if for a memorandum.
examples: Caesar's Commentaries on the Gallic War

entries.meaning: An oral relation of an event, especially broadcast by television or radio, as it occurs.
examples: We listened to the football commentary while watching the match.
